description.string: Read and listen to a story of a boy who responds to a series of mysterious commands to go to different places and wear various disguises. Share his confusion until the end, when a surprise is revealed. Use the glossary tool if you are unsure of a word. Then try some follow-up activities to test your understanding of the vocabulary and sentence structures used in the story.

otherPlatformRequirements.string: Initial load time may exceed 10 seconds on a dedicated 64 kbit/s connection due to the use of rich media content. These objects were originally produced for CD-based delivery and to ensure an accurate presentation it is suggested that the user waits approximately 1 minute or until the learning object has finished loading before commencing the activity.

description.string: © NSW Department of Education and Training, 2004

kind.source: The GEM Element Set Qualifier Vocabulary
The GEM Element Set Qualifier Vocabulary

description.string: Large thumbnail version of current resource
v.2.0 Includes updated metadata: topics, technical and rights metadata. Includes technical maintenance fixes. v.1.0 Originally published on CD-ROM by NSW Department of Education and Training in 2004.

entry.string: Students use contextual clues to deduce meaning from a story.
Students identify the purpose of, and participants in, a text.
Students practise the key vocabulary and sentence structures used in each story.
Presents the story as a comic, with strong visual support.
Supports development of students' reading and listening skills by providing the story in both written and audio formats.
Provides a comprehensive glossary to support each page of the comic.
Includes a wonderword activity in which students find words in English.
Provides a matching activity in which students flip cards to find pairs (with matching options including audio to text, audio to picture, and text to picture).
Includes a make-a-picture activity in which students consider a clue (audio, text or graphic) and then find its matching audio, text or graphic item.
Includes a quiz activity that reinforces key vocabulary from the story.
Includes a story-sequencing activity in which students match texts to pictures.

item.title: Start: ESL Readers: A mysterious meeting

description.string: Read and listen to a story of a boy who responds to a series of mysterious commands to go to different places and wear various disguises. Share his confusion until the end, when a surprise is revealed. Use the glossary tool if you are unsure of a word. Then try some follow-up activities to test your understanding of the vocabulary and sentence structures used in the story.
